supporting.text: Leap years occur every 4 years, not every 5 years, as defined by the Gregorian calendar.

attacks.text: Leap years occur every 4 years, not every 5 years, as defined by the Gregorian calendar.

The Gregorian calendar's leap year rule has exceptions (e.g., years divisible by 100 but not by 400 are not leap years), complicating the 'every 4 years' claim.
These exceptions are rare (e.g., 1900 was not a leap year) and do not significantly alter the general 4-year pattern.
